description: A heavy protective coat worn by firefighters, highly resistant to heat and flame.
A piece of clerical clothing, usually worn by Christian priests.
A long white coat with several large pockets.  Comes with a very nice pocket protector.
A vinyl coat with a hood and two very large pockets, meant to provide protection from rain.
An intricately sewn coat of treated and split intestines, prized for its light weight and waterproof qualities among the indigenous peoples of the arctic.
A warm, padded coat with deep pockets and a hood.
A full-length coat made of tough, rain-repellant material.  It has several pockets.
A full-length coat made of warm animal fur.
A thick faux fur longcoat, falling below your knees.  Has many pockets for storing things.
A full-length leather coat with many pockets for storage.
A long overcoat made from durable heavyweight wool.
Japanese pants traditionally worn with kimono or kendogi, they have wide legs and seven distinctive pleats.
A terrycloth housecoat generally worn on the way to or from the bath.

//: Vietnam Jungle Jacket, DBDU jacket, etc.
description: A vintage piece of a military uniform from the 20th century, or possibly a newer reproduction of one.  It's a comfortable jacket made of lightweight poplin
A fitted camouflage jacket, referred to as a blouse because it is worn untucked as part of a modern military uniform.

pocket_data.//: min. length really just a hack to avoid adding a flag.

description: A double-breasted uniform to protect against the heat of the kitchen.
A bright, cheaply made FEMA-issue windbreaker jacket with a hood.  It's not much, but it might keep you from freezing until rescue arrives, assuming anyone's coming...
A jacket made from flannel, favored by outdoorsy types.
A jacket made from denim.
A vest made from denim.
A soft leather jacket.  It's tough, but not as heavy-duty as the kind favored by motorcyclists.
A warm jacket made of animal fur, once a symbol of wealth.
A jacket made of fake animal fur.  While not as fancy as a fur coat, its garish appearance still makes quite a statement.
A warm vest made of animal fur.
A warm vest made of fake animal fur.
A lightweight nylon bomber jacket.
A thin cotton jacket with a hood.  Good for brisk weather.
A light synthetic jacket with a hood.  Not very warm, but will keep out the rain.
A cotton varsity jacket, the type that the jocks in a highschool or a college would wear.
A durable cotton jacket used as the top half of a uniform in many Japanese martial arts.

variants.description: A durable cotton jacket used as the top half of a uniform in many Japanese martial arts.
A distinctive cotton jacket worn by practitioners of the Korean art of Taekwando.  It's lightweight, but sturdy enough to go to the mat.

description: A traditional ankle-length Buddhist robe, stitched together from three pieces of traditional saffron dyed cloth.

A loose-fitting Chinese jacket with a mandarin collar and frog ties down the front.  These were once common street fashion in China, but have long since become associated with martial arts from that country.
A traditional ankle-length Japanese robe, wrapped around the body with a sash.
A Japanese robe similar to a Kimono, it's made of lightweight cotton, perfect for the Summer.
A loose coat with wide sleeves that is typically worn unfastened over a kimono.
A white, knee-length cotton robe, traditionally worn by Jews on special occasions.
A thick and heavy leather jacket used most commonly by motorcyclists, equestrians, and other Road Warriors.
A heavy wool coat, warm and with deep pockets.
A long, plush housecoat, perfect for lounging around the house.
A white hooded ghost's robe characteristic of souls that haunt the living world.
A cheap ghost costume comprised of a white sheet with two eye holes cut out.  A simple hat is worn underneath to keep the sheet in place.
A black hooded grim reaper's robe with a face cover to hide the user's lack of facial skin.  It pairs nicely with a scythe.  Use it to remove the face cover and show yourself before your victims.
A mysterious and arcane-looking robe.  It has a hood and some pockets for your magical artifacts.
A traditional, double-layered Buddhist coat.  Used as an outer cloak for various occasions.
A red jacket, trimmed with white faux fur, commonly used by bearded men on Christmas.  Warm and has a couple of small pockets.
A short red jacket with white faux fur as trim, similar to a Santa jacket but sleeveless, for a more revealing look on Christmas.
An insulated, breathable hoodie made for alpine skiing.  Very warm, and with sizable pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless longcoats is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A rugged full-length longcoat that leaves your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.

//: The general guideline for sleeveless longcoats is the components, volume, weight, time to craft, and value are 15% lower (rounded down) than the original.  Making it from an original takes 50% the time.
description: A thick fur full-length longcoat without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.
A thick, sleeveless faux fur longcoat, falling below your knees.  Has many pockets for storing things.
A thick leather full-length longcoat without sleeves, leaving your arms unencumbered.  Has plenty of storage space due to its many pockets.
A sleeveless cloth garment that covers the torso and legs.
A long, loose-fitting robe with wide sleeves.  A traditional Arab garment.
A long-sleeved top that drapes almost to the knees.
A makeshift knee-length robe with a string tied around the waist to keep it all in place.
A full-body tuxedo.  Makes the apocalypse feel a little more classy.
An elegant waistcoat.  Ideal for those occasions when wearing only a shirt would be too casual and a suit would be overdoing it.
A hooded jacket with lots of pockets, thickly padded for warmth.  Favored by the military.
A dark robbed cassock worn by plague doctors.
A dark piece of clerical clothing.  Typically worn by Christian nuns.
A jacket with a hood and several pockets.
